lines.text: Oh, Miss Garvin, I've something to show to you. Just look at that beautiful ad!
It's terrible! Look at the size of that print. Why you can't even read my name. That sort of thing is alright for Ethel Barrymore or Gloria Swanson. But not for Garvin!
Why, you two again. Oh, and that infernal monkey! Take him away!
Say, you don't need to get so high-hat. Your ancestors swung from trees too.
You'll have to put the monkey in the baggage car.
Well, Napoleon means an awful lot to our act.
Well, if anything happens to him, you can put on a beard and play the part yourself.
Now, come on, scram. If you don't want to miss the show. Beat it girls, beat it.
Why don't you go away and stop annoying us!
My candy! My negligee!
I think she's daffy. Everything we have, she thinks belongs to her.

Trying to make a monkey out of me! Well, you pretty near succeeded. I'm going crazy managing a bunch of lunatics like you are! And I'm the one that's crazy for ever letting you two dames on the train!
I've eaten apples for supper for so long that I'm beginning to look like one.
Yes, ma'am?
You're wanted on the telephone.
Oh, Thelma, I'll bet Zasu, I know that Aunt Leone of mine has died again.

[On the phone]
Hello? Hello?
This is Goldstein, Goldblatt, Goldwaite and O'Brien Booking Agents. O'Brien speaking.
Yes, ma'am.
I've booked you girls and your singing monkey with "Hot Shots" - the biggest show of the year.
Oh! A negligee for me! Isn't that marvelous!
Why don't you two dames go to sleep?

[after Zasu spills a drink on her]
Clumsy!
We're Pitts & Todd.

[Sarcastically]
Not *the* Pitts & Todd?
Yes, that's us.
